enWisdom: The habit of the wicked is harboring enmity for the righteous

Wisdom: عَادَةُ اللِّئَامِ وَالْأَغْمَارِ أَذِيَّةُ الْكِرَامِ وَالْأَحْرَارِ
enWisdom: Harming honourable and liberated people is the habit of the vile and ignorant ones

Wisdom: مَنْ عَامَلَ النَّاسَ بِالْإِسَاءَةِ كَافَئُوهُ بِهَا
enWisdom: Whoever deals with the people in a beautiful manner, they respond to him in a similar fashion

Wisdom: مَا أَمِنَ عَذَابَ اللَّهِ مَنْ لَمْ يَأْمَنِ النَّاسُ شَرَّهُ
enWisdom: He from whose evil people are not safe, is not secure from the punishment of Allah

Wisdom: لَا يَنْجُو مِنَ اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ مَنْ لَا يَنْجُو النَّاسُ مِنْ شَرِّهِ
enWisdom: He from whose evil people are not safe, is not saved from [the punishment of] Allah, the Glorified
The judicious person is one who does not harm others
The gain of the intellect is refraining from harming others

Wisdom: مَنْ كَفَّ أَذَاهُ لَمْ يُعَانْدُه [لَمْ يُعَادِهِ‏] أَحَدٌ
enWisdom: One who prevents himself from harming [others] will not be opposed [or hated] by anyone

Wisdom: مِنْ أَمَارَاتِ الْخَيْرِ الْكَفُّ عَنِ الْأَذَى
enWisdom: From the signs of goodness is refraining from harming others

Wisdom: مَنْعُ أَذَاكَ يُصْلِحُ لَكَ قُلُوبَ عِدَاكَ
enWisdom: Preventing yourself from harming [others] reforms the hearts of your enemies towards you
